content:
It sounds like you've already made significant progress in establishing a consistent wake-up time, and congratulations on your new job!

Adjusting to a new wake-up time, especially when it's earlier than usual, can be challenging. It's great that you've been able to make the transition to 7:15 am successfully. Now, by fine-tuning your bedtime and morning routine, you can work towards waking up feeling more rested and refreshed.

Remember, it might take some time for your body to adjust to the new sleep schedule, so be patient and don't get discouraged if you don't see immediate results. The key is to make small, sustainable changes that you can maintain in the long run.

Since you've already made significant progress, I'm confident that you can continue to refine your sleep habits and wake up feeling more rested and refreshed. Keep me updated on your progress, and we can make adjustments as needed.

Also, don't forget to celebrate your small wins along the way! You've already achieved a significant milestone by adjusting to a new wake-up time, and that's something to be proud of.

How do you feel about tracking your sleep and wake-up times for the next week or two to see how your body responds to the new bedtime and morning routine? Would you be willing to share your progress with me?
